item.title: Engineering Manager, Privacy Engineering
item.description:
Working at Atlassian
Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.
We have an office in Bengaluru but as we continue to expand our footprint in India, we can hire eligible candidates remotely anywhere in India.
Today customers are becoming more and more particular about their data, not just in the way it's stored and transmitted but also in the ways it is processed by organizations. Needless to say, handing over the finer control of their data to opt-in, opt-out, or for free usage is a must-have for any organization. On the other hand, the cost of not having this is huge, customers are not going to use our products with confidence which would decrease customer trust and directly affect the revenues.
Atlassian today is 6000 people engineering org and is growing quickly. How do we create a system for all the engineers so that they are able to focus on their core businesses while being aware of the privacy and data needs but not having to be worried about them? Imagine a scenario where a customer has a complete view of how their data (both UGC and Usage data) is being processed or prevented from being processed. How do we continue to show the customers that they have control of their data and there are systems which honor that?
If any of this excites you, then this is a wonderful opportunity to be a part of this team and build this from scratch. This team is going to be a part of the Trust Engineering org, which solves various interesting engineering challenges in the Trust org spanning risk and compliance, security, security intelligence, trust engagement, etc.

Atlassian helps teams everywhere change the world. Our products are revolutionizing the software industry and helping teams collaborate and craft the magic that delivers their best work. Think NASA launching the Rover on Mars or Cochlear gifting those born deaf with the ability to hear, your work directly impacts the products they use to advance humanity. One of these products is Opsgenie - a modern incident management platform for operating always-on services, empowering DevOps & ITSM teams to plan for service disruptions and stay in control during incidents. Opsgenie centralizes alerts, advises the right people reliably, and enables them to collaborate and take rapid action. Opsgenie also has a track record of operating at five-nines availability. This means reliability is built into our processes, systems, tools, and attitude.
We live and breathe reliability.

We provide a platform leveraged by all of Atlassian's products which enables concepts such as the creation of new tenancy at signup, management of the tenant lifecycle (licence changes, product suspension, deletion, etc), and data residency. Some of our primary responsibilities include: allowing, and ensuring high reliability of, the creation and management of our customers' tenants, building a self service platform for other internal teams, and working with a variety of product teams to ensure they can achieve their goals. This is a rapidly growing area where you will have significant opportunity to help shape the success of Atlassian's current and growing product suite and overall inspiring company growth goals. You will report to a Senior Engineering Manager, and manage a team of approximately 8 developers.

Atlassian is looking for a seasoned Engineering Manager to lead one of Ecosystem development teams in Gdansk. The Atlassian Ecosystem has been wildly successful: we surpassed $2 billion in lifetime revenue on the Atlassian Marketplace and over 60% of Jira Software and Confluence customers use at least one Marketplace app. Now, the teams powering the platform behind this Ecosystem have a huge role to play in enabling our customers' journey to the Cloud. Together, we are enabling customers to confidently extend their Atlassian Cloud products, without trading off on security or reliability. As a manager of Ecosystem team, you'll envision, build and operate services and APIs that empower third-party app development on Jira Cloud and other products. Our goal is to make Jira a powerful and easy to use extensibility platform for third-party app development. On top of that, we focus on making the platform cater to the needs of Enterprise customers with security and compliance standards - we will make sure they feel safe building their own apps and installing 3rd party apps. Together, we will make sure every team, big or small, can safely customize Jira to their needs. In this role, you will collaborate closely not only with your immediate team but also with engineers across a wide range of Atlassian product and platform teams, as well as with product managers and 3rd party vendors.

We've built our Atlassian Community team to be a remarkably great place to work.

You will work in close participation with integration teams that include a triad of engineering, design, and product management as well as individual contributors. You will also be responsible for the management of individuals reporting to you. This includes coaching, mentoring, removing blocking issues, and supporting them in their professional development to help unlock their full potential and growth.
Leveraging your back-end and SaaS knowledge, you will take existing integrations to the next level in areas of quality, automation, and scalability to support millions of users. You will be responsible for helping to build and maintain effective teams, empowering them to achieve their goals through inspiration and creativity to help your teams solve difficult challenges. With your software engineering skills and experience, you will help design, build and run solution integrations on the core Jira Align product.

item.title: Design Manager - Cloud Infrastructure
item.description:
Working at Atlassian

Are you a strategic thinker who can bring teams together to solve complex problems and get stuff done? If so, we have a phenomenal opportunity for you to set a new ambitious bar for Atlassian’s journey to cloud. We are looking for a Design Manager to lead designers and operate within a leadership triad within Cloud Infrastructure. This platform team is made up of seasoned experts who currently deliver value to all the Atlassian family of products - fun, talented, hardworking who all enjoy playing and working together to define the future of Atlassian for our customers, and our Team. Atlassian’s future lies in the cloud, for our customers, users and ecosystem. In this future lies enormous potential to increase the impact of every Atlassian cloud engineer, from those who work on our internal platforms, to those who strive to improve the experiences of our fanatical end-users. Firstly, we need to empower our own engineering teams, and enable them to do the best work of their lives.
The DCI team leading both the Data and Cloud Infrastructure organizations support a wide number of backbone products and services for Atlassian's internal teams worldwide. With the mission of "Better Engineering, Better Decisions" DCI is investing heavily on providing a strong foundation as the company prepares itself for significant growth in the next two years. Customer Experience as a whole is starting in these two orgs where there are already dozens of teams and hundreds of people cross functionally. The role of design is critical for this growth to build top quality products and services while partnering with Product, Research, and Engineering to determine the direction of this organization that is heavily technical and complex.
As the Design Manager, you will lead a team of passionate Product and Service Designers and partner deeply with your peers in Engineering, Product Management, Content Design, Research & Insights, and Program Management to execute the team’s mission. As a design leader of the core platform area, you will be working across many product teams to understand their needs and ensure our solutions scale, innovate, and delight our customers. As a member of our design leadership team, you will work with other Design Managers, Lead Designers, and other stakeholders to set the vision for the Issue Experience area and deliver an end to end scalable platform solution. You will also be responsible for increasing the level of craft in the team.

Do you get excited about the opportunity to combine DEI with Analytics? Well, we're searching for an experienced and innovative Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) Insights Partner to support our goals to make our TEAM work for everyone. We believe in the power of diversity, we aim for nothing short of equity for every Atlassian, and we are committed to a culture where everyone can thrive. In this role, you will be part of a growing team of internal insight consultants and you will work closely with the Head of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion to drive forward the structural shifts needed to integrate DEI across everything we do—delivering on our promise of openness to our customers and building the kind of company and world we want to live in. The DEI Insights Partner is an integral team member of the wider People Team. The role will focus on working closely with the DEI team and stakeholders across HR and the business to understand challenges and opportunities, frame business questions, and define hypotheses to translate into insights and action, working closely with the wider People Insights team to build solutions at scale. The ideal candidate will be an expert in the field of DEI and have experience in DEI program and strategy measurement and inclusion research, have strong analytical and business acumen and have experience delivering insights to a diverse set of stakeholders. You are a self-starter, eager to learn, focused on impact, and have demonstrated success in building strong partnerships through the delivery of data and insights that drive understanding, progression, and decision-making for large organizations.

Atlassian is looking for a Data Engineer to join our Go-To Market Data Engineering (GTM-DE) team which is responsible for building our data lake, maintaining our big data pipelines / services and facilitating the movement of billions of messages each day. We work directly with the business stakeholders and plenty of platform and engineering teams to enable growth and retention strategies at Atlassian. We are looking for an open-minded, structured thinker who is passionate about building services that scale. On a typical day you will help our stakeholder teams ingest data faster into our data lake, you'll find ways to make our data pipelines more efficient, or even come up ideas to help instigate self-serve data engineering within the company. Then you will move on to building micro-services, architecting, designing, and enabling self serve capabilities at scale to help Atlassian grow. You'll get the opportunity to work on a AWS based data lake backed by the full suite of open source projects such as Spark and Airflow. We are a team with little legacy in our tech stack and as a result you'll spend less time paying off technical debt and more time identifying ways to make our platform better and improve our users experience. More about you: As a data engineer in the GTM-DE team, you will have the opportunity to apply your strong technical experience building highly reliable services on managing and orchestrating a multi-petabyte scale data lake. You enjoy working in a fast paced environment and you are able to take vague requirements and transform them into solid solutions. You are motivated by solving challenging problems, where creativity is as crucial as your ability to write code and test cases.

item.title: Collaboration/AV Solutions Specialist - California
item.description:
Working at Atlassian
Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.
Collaboration/AV Solutions Specialist
Are you interested in developing and implementing collaboration strategy to enable more than 9000 Atlassian’s around the globe to do the best work of their lives, regardless of their location? Get on board as a Collaboration/AV Solutions Specialist based in the Bay Area! As part of the Workplace Technology Collaboration Team, you’ll be contributing to our global collaboration strategy, evaluating and implementing the latest available technologies to ensure Atlassian remains a leader as we continue to adopt new tools and practices to facilitate remote and hybrid work. You’ll creatively guide, implement and supervise AV technology deployments for our US and European offices and help solve technical problems, small and large. You will also be involved implementing new software, creating documentation, training staff, project managing tasks, and working closely with vendors to get the most out of our investments. You will be the in-region go-to person for our all of our collaboration and AV solutions, and be strongly invested in ensuring local staff have great experiences with all we offer.
A typical work week might include: evaluating a new online collaboration solution, helping a business unit design a remote off-site experience, evaluating new video conferencing solutions, working with an AV integrator to specify the equipment needed for a new office fit out or refurb, meeting with a vendor for a roadmap or business review, reporting on project progress, assisting with executive setups, supporting on-site technology experiments or doing a deep dive into a new online collaboration app or smart building technology. You'll bring your local industry knowledge to find improvement opportunities, participate in developing global AV standards, bills of materials, and help build robust and innovative collaboration capabilities that scale and operate efficiently. You will be involved in comparing, recommending, selecting and overseeing AV Vendors in the US and European regions. One thing we promise: you’ll never be bored.
More about you The right person for this job remains cool under pressure, managing constantly changing demands and priorities in a rapidly growing and changing organization. You're experienced with AV solutions but curious and enthusiastic about new technologies, self-motivated, manage your time well in all contexts, and know when to ask for direction. You actively seek to develop yourself and define your role. You are engaged in your working relationships, provide and receive feedback graciously, are experienced working with a globally distributed team, and training/mentoring of local support staff. You search for opportunities to innovate and keep Atlassian on the bleeding edge.

item.title: Chief of Staff, Operations
item.description:
Working at Atlassian
Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.
Summary:
Atlassian is seeking a Chief of Staff to the Head of Operations to partner & help the Operations Group supercharge Atlassian’s ability to get (the right) shit done. The Operations Group is the backbone connecting our planning and execution across Atlassian, driving operational excellence all the way. Together we enable, unify & accelerate company-wide transformations and raise the bar on operational excellence. In this role you will partner with the Head of Operations to land key strategic initiatives, keep the team focused & executing on business priorities while driving day to day group operations. You will be a critical thought leader and catalyst for activation and change management, collaborating across the business to ensure cross-functional alignment of goals and execution.
In this role, you'll get to:
Be a strategic partner to the Head of Operations and Ops leadership team to maximise business outcomes. Build strong partnerships and strategic alignment with executive leaders and key cross-functional stakeholders. Be a catalyst for driving change and accountability by ensuring there is transparency and two way communication loops between leadership and execution teams. Drive business strategy, alongside the leadership team, from development through successful execution to meet the Operations Group & Atlassian’s objectives (e.g. strategic initiatives, cross-functional strategic processes, long-term vision/roadmap planning etc). Support/own the Head of Operations and the Ops Leaders in the preparation of executive & company wide internal communications, ensuring timely communication and flow of information between department's, offices/geo’s while owning the inputs/outputs. Drive/oversee cross-functional projects/initiatives from development through to execution, bringing together multiple stakeholders to help drive decisions and ensure alignment. Create structure and focus to key initiatives that the team is exploring. Help Ops leadership assign priority and recommendations based on business outcomes. Own the teams overall operating rhythm, always looking at process improvement, systems, operational cadences. Be a culture champion, building strong connections at all levels of the business in order to identify, surface, and execute on areas of culture and organizational change.
On your first day, we'll expect you to have:
10+ years experience; background in top tier management consulting or high growth technology organization. Demonstrated experience leading high-impact projects for the business, especially those which innovate, improve business execution, and/or span multiple products and teams. Strong product and commercial acumen with a strong ability to frame decisions. Excellent cross-functional collaboration and connector skills and experience. Excellent time management, intentional prioritization, ability to maintain and curate backlog. Experience leading transformational org/team initiatives in a Cloud Computing/SaaS environment/industry a plus. Experience leading change and transformation is a bonus. Creative problem solving (i.e. excels at identifying trends and patterns, developing root cause diagnosis, and using a diverse toolkit to address challenges and root causes).

On your first day, we'll expect you to have:

Atlassian's Channel community is growing and we are looking for amazing TEAM members to help us take our Channel Program to the next level. You will be a necessary part of the Global Channel Team, leading the Global Channel Program for Atlassian. These programs help build an ecosystem of Partners to position Atlassian products and solutions to customers. You will help in the evolution and launch of our channel program, define roadmap programs for channel programs, and deliver benefits to motivate and excite Channel Partners. The Channel Programs Team Lead is responsible for the design and effectiveness of the Atlassian Partner Program (frameworks, processes, planning and procedures for all programs). Success in the role is building a program that has Channel Partners delighting customers with Atlassian products and solutions.

The DACH region is Atlassian's largest market in Europe, with fast growth in all segments including enterprise. Atlassian's low-touch model together with our existing channel partners has served us very well, but we also understand that at scale, doing business in this territory requires a stronger local presence. To support the continued rapid growth we are expanding the DACH channels team. We are looking for a passionate channel manager who understands how to drive business together with specialist and strategic partners, and with experience working successfully with medium and large consultancy and services companies. The Channel Manager's primary responsibility is to focus on extending Atlassian's business model through the recruitment and development of a portfolio of consulting and services Partners. The Manager will be responsible for finding, growing and shaping partners to build Atlassian mind and market share in the region. Atlassian is growing and we are looking for an exceptional individual who understands the channel business, and also understands how to grow and manage a region. Recruiting and enabling partners is a large part of the position, as is the ability to drive marketing and sales activities with your partners to increase brand awareness and Atlassian product adoption.

item.title: Business Lead, Enterprise Cloud Migrations
item.description:
Working at Atlassian
Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.
Shifting our on-premises customers to Cloud is one of Atlassian's top priority goals. Massive company initiatives like MPT, Cloud Shift have been founded to ensure the customer experience and ROI in Cloud is better than Server. In order to continue scaling our business to take on more of our top-tier, enterprise-level customers, Atlassian is now in need of a leader dedicated to the success and scale of the enterprise-level customer migration journey. This person will be responsible for developing the direction and roadmap of this cohort's journey to their successful migration to Cloud. As an Enterprise Business Lead/Operations PgM for Atlassian's Cloud Migrations team, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring deep learning and scale of enterprise-level customer needs, where the gaps are in our current process offerings, and create a best-in-class migrations experience. You will be responsible for driving strategic programs and projects cross-functionally across the whole enterprise funnel from sales to product (GTM, CSS, CSI, etc.) working closely with other program managers and team leaders globally to scale best practices from innovation to adoption and champion continuous improvement. This role will be accountable for defining and driving clean project execution against a plan you collaboratively design to deliver measurable outcomes for the customer and Atlassian teams. You will partner closely with executive stakeholders to set quarterly delivery initiatives that support the mission while maintaining funnel oversight to manage risks and influencing product improvements. Additionally, you will lead discovery with cross-functional teams to identify and resource surfaced insights as well as radiate customer behavior themes and patterns that will be leveraged for actioning larger improvement initiatives across maturing solution models and customer cohorts.
Scope: 1. Own program for enterprise funnel. Deeply understand end-to-end journey for high-touch, enterprise-level customers. 2. Committed dedication to keeping CSS process improvements top of mind. ex. enterprise funnel health, Cloud Migrations (CMM/MSE) team projects, pre-sales and post-migration hypercare handovers, etc. 3. Share business insights, program learnings, and funnel trends from customers, blocker programs, ENT-VOC, etc. to prioritize with product 4. Own oversight of enterprise-level blockers list, driving strategic programs/initiatives aimed at reducing/removing top blockers/friction areas for enterprise migrators, and providing recommendations to leaders across the organization for addressing high-impact opportunities. 5. Partner with OET to communicate themes, improve processes, and enhance overall journey for enterprise customers. (Example to engage OET: "we have X issue- OET help us solve this") 6. Document and own large scale updates for BAU programs such as executive sponsors, guardrails, sales hand over, SWAT hand over to ensure program maintenance

Identity Platform is the foundation of our cloud platform and plays a critical part in Atlassian’s success. The Identity team is on a journey to supporting 1 billion user accounts to help us achieve Atlassian BHAG (big hairy audacious goal). Identity sets an example for the whole company in reliability, scalability, and operational excellence. Working in Identity, you’ll get to write software that is used by all Atlassian products and impacts the everyday experience of all our users.
We’re looking for a highly motivated and talented engineer with hands-on experience designing and developing cloud-native applications. You’ll build highly scalable, multi-region solutions using modern best practices and technologies.
As a Backend Engineer, you’ll work with a team of talented engineers to design and implement the most innovative, scalable, and performant solutions. You will work closely with other Identity teams, architects, product managers, and designers. You’ll be responsible for breaking down the work, building, and shipping new features and capabilities in our highly scalable, cross-geo distributed system. As we use a “you build it, you run it” (YBIYRI) approach in all Cloud Platform teams, you’ll demonstrate excellence in operational maturity, and help the team define and deliver on reliability, scalability, and latency goals.

Atlassian’s Access team is seeking a driven and experienced Software Engineer to join our growing Cloud Security team. Access provides the ability to extend our customer's identity providers to Atlassian cloud offerings from Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and many more. Innovation is a key to our organization's culture and it is our team's mission to find innovative solutions to better our administrative experiences in the identity and policy management space.
As part of Atlassian's Cloud Security team, you will be working on various strategic objectives part of our customer cloud adoption and transformation. You will be responsible for developing and hosting a highly available control plane built using micro-services-based architecture. Using this portal our customer administrators will be able to configure and connect to their corporate identity providers of choice. They also have the ability to customize their authentication and authorization flows using custom policies to prevent unauthorized access. You get to define how customers and their users connect to the Atlassian cloud offerings like Jira, Confluence, BitBucket, Trello, and JSM (Jira Service Management). The Admins will also be able to manage the lifecycle of customer API Tokens used for API access. You will be using industry-standard cloud-native components and protocols towards establishing secure practices while simplifying the end-user experience.

The ideal candidate has experience crafting and launching compelling end-to-end campaigns while leveraging channels including, but not limited to, paid media, email, content syndication, direct mail, events, and more. The ABM Campaign Manager will also be closely tracking campaign and channel-level performance to ensure we optimize campaigns and drive campaign efficiencies. The ABM Campaign Manager will be a key partner to our EMEA ABM Manager and the EMEA Strategic Sales Team - both our Enterprise Advocates (EAs) and Enterprise Development Representatives (EDRs) teams.
Your future team This role will report to the Global Lead, ABM and sits within our Customer Lifecycle Marketing (CLM) organisation.
